Certify.origin: [Medieval Latin certificare , from Late Latin, to assure, convince, from Latin certus certain + - ficare to make]

-fyÂ·ing.definition: [Medieval Latin, from Late Latin, to assure, convince, from Latincertain + -to make]

sub_terms.a: to give assurance of the validity of [ corporate records]
sub_terms.b: to present in formal communication (as an order) esp. for review by an appellate court [the court may the question to the Supreme Judicial Court "R. T. Gerwatowski"] see also
sub_terms.c: to state as being true or as reported or as meeting a standard [refused to the suit as a class action and dismissed it "Marcia Coyle"]

2.definition: to guarantee (a personal check) as to signature and amount by so indicating (as by stamping) on the face see alsoat

sub_terms.b: to designate (a labor union) as an exclusive bargaining agent or representative
